docs.text: Xtyle | CSS Welcome to Xtyle-CSS a tool design to be a colorless and without components framework. Main purpose is to complement Xtyle . But you can use this as a standalone tool. No Install < link rel = "stylesheet" href = "https://unpkg.com/xtyle-css@latest" /> Tools d | m | p | t | b | s | o | row | col | g Utils Key Description d Display m Margin (Spacing) p Padding (Spacing) t Text b Border s Shadow o Overflow row Row (Rows & Columns) col Column (Rows & Columns) g Gap (Rows & Columns) Inspired by Normalize.css This project now also includes the normalize.css A couple of projects including bootstrap have inspired me to make my own set of tools built with consonantly seen ideas. If you are looking for a production ready , i will recommend using on of these tools or another tool. Material Design Lite Vuetify Chota Tachyons

docs.text: Util | Borders Follow this schema b{type}-{value} . Borders (Options) Key Description bw Border- Width ~ Options: ( 0 to 5 ) bs Border- Style ~ Options: ( dotted - dashed - solid ) br Border- Radius ~ Options: ( 0 to 4 ) and ( 100p - pill - b - t - r - l ) bd Border- Display ~ Options: ( a - b - t - r - l ) or ( n - nb - nt - nr - nl ) Tip You will notice the " b , t , r , l " a lot and sometimes the " n " B stands for Bottom T stands for Top R stands for Right L stands for Left and . . . N stands for Negative aka: the opposite. In this case display : none borders. A stands for All In this case display : all borders. Demo < div class = "bw-2 bs-solid" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "bs-dotted" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "br-pill bs-solid" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "bd-a" > Hello World </ div >

docs.text: Util | Display and Alignment Follow this schema d-{type} Key Description d-b css -> display: block d-ib css -> display: inline-block d-f css -> display: flex d-if css -> display: inline-flex d-n css -> display: none Demo | Display < div class = "d-b" > Display: Block </ div > < div class = "d-ib" > Display: Inline-Block </ div > < div class = "d-f" > Display: Flex </ div > < div class = "d-if" > Display: Inline-Flex </ div > < div class = "d-n" > Display: None </ div > Alignment (Options) Follow this schema d{ y | x }-{spacing} Key Description dy css -> align-items dx css -> justify-content Demo | Alignment < div class = "d-f dx-fs" > Flex-Start </ div > < div class = "d-f dy-st" > Stretch </ div > DY and DX (Options) Key Description fs css -> flex-start fe css -> flex-end ce css -> center DY | Align-Items (Options) Key Description st css -> stretch DX | Justify-Content (Options) Key Description sb css -> space-between sa css -> space-around se css -> space-evenly Demo | Flex-Grow < div class = "d-f dx-sb" > < div class = "df-g1" > Big </ div > < div class = "df-g0" > Small </ div > < div class = "df-g1" > Big </ div > </ div > DF | Flex-Grow (Options) Key Description df-g0 css -> flex-grow: 0 df-g1 css -> flex-grow: 1 DF | Flex-Direction (Options) Key Description df-row css -> flex-direction: row df-col css -> flex-direction: column df-col The flex-direction: column requires a fixed height . For the flex-grow to work.

Key Description ts Text- Size ~ Options: ( 1 to 6 ) td Text- Decoration ~ Options: ( i - b - u - s ) tt Text- Transform ~ Options: ( t - u - l ) ta Text- Align ~ Options: ( c - r - l ) tf Text- Font Text Fonts sans-serif | serif | code | courier | helvetica | avenir | athelas | georgia | times | bodoni | calisto | garamond | baskerville Demo < div class = "ts-6" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "td-i" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "tt-u" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "ta-c" > Hello World </ div > < div class = "tf-code" > Hello World </ div > Options Text Transform t meaning Title ( capitalize ) u meaning Upper ( uppercase ) l meaning Lower ( lowercase ) Text Decoration i meaning Italic ( italic ) b meaning Bold ( bold ) u meaning Underline ( underline ) s meaning Strike ( line-through ) Text Align c meaning Center ( center ) l meaning Left ( left ) r meaning Right ( right )
